intro: Pseudoclausia sarawschanica, commonly known as the Sarawak hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
